website_summaries.verdict: Though a handheld fertilizer spreader won't work for everyone or all types of contents, this model is a good choice for anyone who has a small space and prefers a small, lightweight option.
pros: Gardeners love this affordable, handy tool for its lightweight, handheld design that's easy to use
Delivers battery-powered efficiency and has 23 settings
Covers up to 2,500 square feet and has Scotts EdgeGuard technology
cons: Will require frequent refills for large areas of land
Works best with small-sized product, as the motor has been known to have trouble moving the mechanism to discharge larger pellets

customer_reviews.title: Super Spreader
customer_reviews.text: I just used this for the first time. It works fine. Batteries were still good at the end of the job. I have a very large yard and a bad leg so I fashioned a mount for the front of my zero-turn riding mower to avoid walking so much. The locking mechanism on the trigger switch allows me to turn it on and not have to hold the trigger down. See photo. Worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Ray928

customer_reviews.title: Handy Spreader
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty happy with this and wanted to give it 5 stars but there's two minor flaws. 1. The dial selector doesn't translate from the commonly established settings that everyone publishes on their packaging for the larger rotary spreaders. The Wizz does come with a little instruction card to do that but that's annoying to keep around. I've included a picture of that. I wish it was at least printed on the Wizz. 2. I wish it was a little bigger but that's a minor gripe. Otherwise it's a well made and designed product. I like the built in loop to enable it to be hung up as well as it comes with batteries already installed.
customer_reviews.author: Toolster

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but flawed.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little spreader but it has some obvious flaws. Pro: 1) Came with batteries. 2)Can do a decent job of spreading granular material. Cons: 1)Less than 10lbs spread (when set on 3-1/2 or 4) on 4 AA Batteries. Batteries went in at 1.65v, it quits when they are down to 1.46v (remember these are 1.5v batteries!)- obscene usage. 2)Tried with with Barricade and Eagle (medium and small grain products). The angled bottom will not keep the hopper fed unless you tilt the whole machine downwards at a 30 degree angle-which is hard on the wrists. 3) the very small screw holding the battery cover on makes it a PITA to change the batteries; takes several minutes each time.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: I had high expectations, but....
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Small - Lightweight Cons: - Weak motor - Battery died 10 min into 1st use - Battery compartment design is very difficult to work, specially if you have product in bin - Battery compartment requires a jeweler philips screwdriver To unscrew compartment - After Battery replacement, the bin must be emptied before motor restarts. Overall, the device was a good concept, but with the weak motor, and difficulties with the Battery compartment, I had to return the device and replaced it with a SOLO 421.
customer_reviews.author: IX XIII

customer_reviews.title: Not sure.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a golf course chem tech. I'm used to professional grade stuff. But now I'm a home owner with 2000 square feet of lawn to manage and I can't afford a $200 spreader. I'm also old and don't want to work hard. So I gave this 5 stars because it works. But you truly have to be an artist to not dump too much seed or fertilizer in one spot. I've used it now with 20 lbs of seed and 20 lbs of triple 16. It's a good tool but make sure to clean it or it won't work and don't expect professional results.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis H.

customer_reviews.title: Drains batteries, doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I debated about getting a hand crank spreader but all the good reviews of this one lured me. Don’t waste your money. It spread two small bags of seed before it died and now, any brand new batteries I put in it are immediately drained and won’t power anything after I try it in this spreader. Very disappointed. Just buy a hand crank or push behind spreader and save yourself the frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Very frustrating
customer_reviews.text: It worked well at the beginning and I was able to finish fertilizing my front lawn. About 15 feet into my back lawn, it just stopped. I made sure there were no clumps or other obstructions in the fertilizer and then tried again. It still wouldn't work so I concluded the batteries were bad. But the screw head that holds the battery door stripped out before the screw would move. So I drilled out the screw and replaced the batteries. The little motor then worked, but poorly and intermittently. The spread wasn't even and I'm afraid I may have burned areas of lawn. The spreader is now at the bottom of my trash can.
customer_reviews.author: D. Olsby

customer_reviews.title: Overall, for the price, you can't beat it ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, for the price, you can't beat it. Works very well. Only (small) issue I found while using this is that sometimes the unit won't shut off when you release the trigger. Depending on the seed type, the seeds will bunch up, not allowing the door to close forcing the unit to continue to run/allowing seeds to continue feeding into the spreader. If you pull the trigger in and immediately release it again, it normally closes and shuts off.
customer_reviews.author: 124XL

customer_reviews.title: 4 Years
customer_reviews.text: After many uses and many batteries, it lasted 4 years to the day which is not bad for the price! The battery compartment is plastic, so when I tried to pry it open, it collapsed. It worked great for my needs of spreading ant bait granules on a monthly basis over an acre, and spreading grass seed. Easy to handle, not too heavy. It just sucks up batteries quickly. Since there are no other choices out there besides hand crank (not doing that), I'm back for a replacement. This time I'm getting rechargeable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Mother Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE OF POOR QUALITY AND MOVE ON TO ANOTHER SPREADER. THIS ONE DOES NOT CUT THE MUSTARD
customer_reviews.text: This spreader arrived today and I loaded the hopper half full with lime before starting to use it. It failed after about 3 minutes of use. The motor just stopped. I thought the batteries that came with it may be weak and replaced them. The problem is the motor itself has no power to move product. The switch then stuck in the running position and I finally got the thing to stop. Boxed it up and it is ready to go to the UPS Store in the morning. I really like the design as it is much more ergonomically comfortable than a hand crank spreader. Unfortunately, Scotts did not put any effort into making the damn thing work!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Mason

customer_reviews.title: probably not appropriate for salt
customer_reviews.text: Although advertised for use with ice melt, I found it to be not the correct tool. It probably works well for seeds. We'll find out in the spring. There are several problems with salt: if the crystals are too large (like mine are) you need to open the gap to get anything through. However, passing very large crystals through the chute tends to jam the mechanism. If you get the opening small enough not to jam the mechanism then sometimes the arm inside the bucket will get jammed. Maybe if you get really fine grained salt this won't be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Miller

customer_reviews.title: It's a great idea, but it doesn't deliver
customer_reviews.text: What I liked most was the thought that it would conveniently spread ice melter; what I liked least was its failure to continue operating after the initial 10-15 seconds of spreading. I already had a manual Scott's handspreader, which frequently jambed while using, and I should have known better. After the WIZZ failed, I emptied the hopper to check for jambs - none. I then rinsed it, dried it, and checked the batteries. It started working again, but I'd lost confidence in its reliability and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: BaldMan

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with De-Icing Products
customer_reviews.text: This may still prove to be an okay device for spreading grass seed but it you’re looking for something to spread your de-icing pellets you’re should look elsewhere. This product is advertised as being able to spread de-icing pellets (that’s why I purchased it) but it cannot. I followed the instructions, set the spreader rate, turned it on and it worked for less than a minute. I replaced the batteries thinking they might be weak but the same thing happened. The motor on this product is so undersized it boggs down in seconds and can’t spread anything. I’ll clean it good and keep for my spring seeding to see how it does but for de-icing you should find something else.
customer_reviews.author: dfwjr

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a good idea, but it came with expired batteries (10/2019) which I discovered after I had used it for less than 5 minutes and it turned off. We replaced the batteries and got it to work for another few minutes before it shut off. We worked and waited and got it to work again for a few minutes, and so on, and so on, and so on. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of two

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This hand held spreader made my life a lot easier. I like that it came with a battery so i didn't have to search for one. The spreader itself did a really nice job, the appliction setting dial was very easy to read and roatate through. The handling of the spreader was a little awkward being that it is front heavy but you want to keep it generally level when you first fill it. It did scatter the fertilizer on my legs so that was a bit odd, but i have to say, it did work. If you don't want to pay full price for a walk behind, this little gadget can get the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed and terribly underpowered
customer_reviews.text: This spreader came with batteries but didn't seem to be powerful enough to run the motor in the spreader. I replaced with new batteries and quickly figured out the problem was with the spreader. For reference, I was using a Scotts grub killing product on the recommended setting listed on the bag with this spreader. Quickly, the wheel in the spreader no longer spun under it's own power. I could freely spin the wheel with my finger so it was not hung up. The motor in the spreader was just not powerful enough to spin. Don't waste your money. This thing is junk. If I didn't throw away the box, I'd be sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M. Forrest II

customer_reviews.title: NOT VERY DURABLE,  Eats Batteries
customer_reviews.text: It worked wonderfully when brand new. It lasted less than one year. After that, it was more work than it was worth, so I returned to my 25 year old Scotts hand crank spreader with the crank. This spreader eats batteries like crazy too! But despite the low quality, the lack of durability, the flimsiness of it, and the fact it eats batteries, I am buying another, because in the 9 or so months it worked, it worked great for me (I am older and hand cranking is hard). If you are on a tight budget, do not get this useless you struggle with the hand crank version for whatever reason.
customer_reviews.author: Last Days Scotty

customer_reviews.title: Only One issue
customer_reviews.text: Unit is lite weight, comes ready to use once batteries (included), are activated. Spreads evenly. Only issue is off trigger is in the dispense trap door which can become plugged causing unit to not stop when you let go of trigger. Gently shaking or tapping to break up the clump worked to get unit to shut off. That said nice tool for use on smaller lawns like ours
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Replace your batteries, motor a little weak, still good though
customer_reviews.text: All together, nice to have. Replaced a manual spreader that has been getting hard to turn for years. Same price for electronic so I tried it. The batteries that came with it seemed to work, but were not powerful enough once filled, so I had to dump out 3-4lb of fertilizer, flip it over, change batteries, and funnel fertilizer in again. Then it worked, though I could hear/feel that the motor is taxed to it's limits when you fill up the hopper. Will just have to fill partially and refill a few times. Still a good product
customer_reviews.author: Redque

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working Seconds after first use
customer_reviews.text: I liked the concept if it actually worked. I waited for the first snow put in some ice melt pellets (no large at all). worked for a few seconds then stopped. I thought it may be the batteries that it came with so I changed them from new and again worked for a few seconded then stopped. I wound up manually spreading the ice melt. The Item was $15 wasted. Too return it is going to be a huge pain.
customer_reviews.author: enthusiastic hobbiest

customer_reviews.title: Made my lawn care easier
customer_reviews.text: I did not want your typical rolling spreader in the garage taking up space so I bough this for that reason. The battery life in it is good and it spreads the seed and fertilizer just fine. It will run out fast so you will be refilling it a lot, but who cares when it is nice outside and you have your headphones on. The biggest pain is replacing the batteries. The compartment is a pain in the butt and this could have been designed better. I do not understand why it has to screwed in other that to be a nuisance.
customer_reviews.author: CHUCKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: If there was less than one star, I'd give it that
customer_reviews.text: I didn't read any reviews when I bought this. It's a Scott product and nothing with their name on it ever disappointed me until this. The batteries that came in ran out before I did half my front yard. I thought everything comes with cheap batteries. I put brand new ones in. They wwere dead before the front yard was done and my whole yard is less than 7500 square feet. Plus if i held it level, it didn't use all the product without tiliting it and when I did it pour out. I went back to my old spreader to finish.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn P Reed

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all Costs
customer_reviews.text: I have the Hand crank one and thought this Power one would be a better spreader BUt it is terrible the batteries die fast. The Fertilizer and Seed build up in the outlet platform clogging it. The Hopper is worthless as the materials do not feed into the outlet you have to constantly shake the unit to feed the outlet with the material in the outlet platform dump out all at once. I went back to the hand Crank One. Lastly, the recommended setting for seed is wrong it is wide open dumping a 5000 bag of seed in a 500 area.
customer_reviews.author: oldtimer

customer_reviews.title: So much easier than the hand-crank one
customer_reviews.text: This is basically a necessary item. The ones that have a crank are difficult because it's really easy to pause for a second and then too much fertilizer falls down and clogs it up, then you can't start up again. With this battery-powered version, you just walk around and it spreads it continually without any problems. Spreading ant-killer, fertilizer, and weed-killer has become a much more tolerable activity. This doesn't hold much, but if you have a small yard, it's sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: G. FarnsworthTop Contributor: Board Games

customer_reviews.title: Works ok spreading fire ant bait
customer_reviews.text: I was using this to broadcast fire ant bait across my large yard, but because the bait granules are so small it was coming out too fast, even at the lowest distribution setting. I compensated by just going on-3-seconds/ off-3-seconds as I walked. Still had to shake the spreader occasionally to keep the granules coming out, but overall it worked. I suspect that with fertilizer, with larger granules, it would work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: FBM

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A DIFFERENCE!
customer_reviews.text: I've used the handcrank ones for years and thought they were just fine. Then I bought this: WOW! It holds more than the hand crank ones but because you hold it down with your arm fully extended, you don't notice the weight. The coverage dial gives many options for output and the slider for angle of disbursement works great. I won't go back to a handcrank unit, I hope that since this is a Scotts it'll hold up season after season.
customer_reviews.author: BeemerPilot

customer_reviews.title: Deserves less than 1 star
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this thinking it will be a space saver over a push behind spreader. Nice product built well but when it comes to use it does not work well. I used Scott's fertilizer (not some other off the shelf brand) and the turning mechanism that turns to spread the fertilizer wouldn't turn or when it would would barely move. I figured the batteries were low so I replaced them. Nope same thing it would work occasionally then not work. The little plastic turning mechanism/motor doesn't have enough power to do much of anything. I wouldn't waste my $ on this and buy a walk behind.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Babbitt

customer_reviews.title: Motor Is A Bit Weak
customer_reviews.text: Great design to prevent the wrist cramps the hurdy-gurdy style manual spreaders always cause, but it's not all that great. The motor is weak and won't turn with the hopper full of granulated fertilizers, although it's okay with a half-hopper load - so I have to walk back-and-forth to keep re-half-filling the hopper. If they'd have just made that motor with a bit more torque, it would have earned five stars. As it is, three is generous..
customer_reviews.author: TinkerTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Pretty easy, but you have to shake it ALL THE TIME
customer_reviews.text: Either you have someone consistently pouring more of whatever you are spreading from over your head into the Wizz Spreader, you are going to get to the point where you have to shake the thing to make it go through within a few seconds to a minute. Even with the right settings with the right Scotts brand fertilizer, I couldn't just easily use the spreader, I had to stop and shake it or basically lean forward a whole bunch to get it to go into the hole. ANYWAY it works, I don't have big yards so I appreciate how handy it is, and I'll keep using it.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Though it may be small, it is mighty!
customer_reviews.text: This spreader works fantastically. We used it to spread granules for killing ants and fleas now that spring is in full swing down here in the south. The open top load is very easy to fill. Just adjust the dial, push the button and you're off. Just keep a steady pace as you're walking to help ensure an even layer of whatever you are spreading.
customer_reviews.author: Crafty Gal

customer_reviews.title: Important, check edge guard !!
customer_reviews.text: Wizz works great. BUT. Run it empty and move the edge guard back and forth. It has to be open or closed in exactly the correct position or it will cause a drag on the spinner which would effect how it spreads and battery life. You can hear it run faster when correct. Edit: Worked great with insect killer. But gummed up with fertilize dust and came to complete stop after 2 fills. Weak motor and not enough battery power for ferilizers.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a year - dead now
customer_reviews.text: Used this last year for feeding the lawn and it is decent but the small size meant having to refill it after just a few minutes. No big deal. Started feeding the lawn this week and all was fine for a while but it just stopped. Replaced the batteries and it worked for about 2 minutes and quit again. Verified that the new batteries were full and even the old batteries showed 70%. Rather disappointing to have this work for exactly a year.
customer_reviews.author: Don Vickers

customer_reviews.title: use it for grass seed
customer_reviews.text: operates on 2 AA bateries--included. no hand cranking like other models--a big advantage---spreads grass seed evenly--much better than sowing by hand. taped the setting guide to the side. i use it 2x per year--Spring & early fall for over seeding. i take the batteries our after each use and rinse it off after each use. put in new batteries each year. if you take care of it it will last for years. i use a John Deere tow behind spreader and a John Deere 240 tractor to spread fertilizer. i get professional results.
customer_reviews.author: ol hoosier

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this expressly to help dispense salt on my driveway and sidewalks. It got clogged 15 seconds after I started spreading salt. I unclogged it and it wouldn’t restart. I resorted to shaking salt out the back end of its hopper. I’m sure my neighbors thought I looked like an idiot. I then swapped out the 4 AA batteries and it worked for 20-30 seconds before stopping again. My conclusion: it’s a P.O.S. I hope it works better for spreading seeds😬.
customer_reviews.author: Jordanaires

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with all sizes of fertilizers/clogs easily
customer_reviews.text: This spreader is not too reliable in my opinion. I purchased it for ease of storage. But it does not consistently spread fertilizers uniformly as a large push spreader does. Yes it's small and takes up only a fraction of the space a push model does but it does not spread very evenly even with new batteries installed it seems to stall out in the middle of a broadcasting. I will stick to more basic conventional spreaders in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Sent defective , it's obvious it's missing battery clamp on two of the battery compartments. Batteries just drop out, without metal clamp battery can't make contact for power. Oh so disappointed, Really needed a spreader for yard , I dug up an old one in shed but Its a different brand. Its unfornate because I purchased their fertilizer I'll be sending it all back since figuring out the measurements per different spreader isn't in the books.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage
customer_reviews.text: What looked like a potentially great product turned out to actually be complete garbage. Followed directions to the letter and it just doesn't work. Changed batteries and it still didn't work. All it does is get constantly clogged with whatever you try to put through it. Once the clog is cleared it immediately, and I mean within a few seconds, gets clogged again. Save your money and headaches and stay away from this.
customer_reviews.author: Banana Joe

customer_reviews.title: Saves a lot of time salting your driveway and salts it evenly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to spread salt around my house and it works great! I wish the instructions were a bit more clear but I figured it out very quickly. It is awesome to no longer have to use a cup to spread salt around, which often resulted in areas with a lot of extra salt and missing certain areas. By simply walking in a straight line down a one car driveway, you can salt the entire width of your driveway. It saves a ton of time.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wasserman

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended at all
customer_reviews.text: I used this twice with decent success. It would always get clogged. I used it one last time and it would not longer spin. Something seemed to be stuck. I had to take it apart and clean it thoroughly. I finally gave up. I talked to Scotts and they said I have to ship it to them... I bought it for $17 and it costs $15 to ship.. I might as well buy a new one. In total it was used probably 10 times. Great idea, poor execution.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: worked great, well built
customer_reviews.text: Worked great w/grass seed. Got it today and seeded a recently cleared area on my property. Someone commented that it was "cheaply built". I did not get that impression at all. Yes it is all plastic but that is not a negative in my eyes. It seems very sturdy to me. Perhaps the negative comment was by someone who expects everything to be cast iron or stainless, weigh 20 pounds and cost $100 more... So far so good. I probably won't be using it much but it sure beats throwing seed by hand or one of those ones you hand crank. I have one of those (somewhere) couldn't find it so I ordered this and am well pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Old-Duckman

customer_reviews.title: Horrible battery usage, and then hard to replace them
customer_reviews.text: Should have read reviews about battery life earlier. I replaced 3 sets of batteries, for 15 mins of use. Each time, it ran out of batteries, within 5 mins, then you have to dump everything out, to replace batteries. So pointless! I have approx 3000sw ft yard, and I couldn't even get 10% fertilized, with 3 sets of batteries. Also, the find fertilizer, doesn't really come out easy. You gotta constantly shake it, like a Shaker. Returned for a refund!
customer_reviews.author: Gaurav

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Evidently it doesn't like small granules but prefers larger? The first time I used it on a low setting (3), it stopped working because it kept getting clogged. Unclogged it and tried again without success. Another reviewer said it didn't work with Milorganite and he is so right. Still I purchased it and shouldn't have bought it. Great concept but not being workable with different fertilizers is a bummer and inconvenient for the buyer. I ended up spreading by hand.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, does job well, but not very durable.
customer_reviews.text: Only giving this a 3 star as it's the second one I had to purchase after the first one's motor died on me. Reached out to customer service for warranty and was promised a refund that never came. The product itself works well. Spreads seeds and other lawn care products easily and evenly. Has spreader setting built to reflect what the product requires. It's light weight and easy to use. Just wish the motor lasted longer than one season and that the company actually followed through with their promise.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: That is fine for me since I never planned to need or ...
customer_reviews.text: This works very well. I have two complaints: 1) To install the batteries you have to unscrew one of the world's smallest screws. Ultimately, I believe that this strip because of its sheer size will strip, but for now, I will just continue to be careful. However, I can tell that that is where we are headed after one season of use. 2) The controlled scatter feature does not really work. That is fine for me since I never planned to need or use such a feature, but for someone who is really counting on it, I would just caution you that it is not a crisp line and is not super controlled.
customer_reviews.author: OKCbudget

customer_reviews.title: The Wizz was!
customer_reviews.text: Batteries did not even last through my small yard. Could be they were old but the tab had not been pulled until I pulled it. Went to change batteries. Had to hunt down a very small screwdriver. Screw is so cheap that little screwdriver bore out the head trying to get the battery compartment open.I could not even get it open to put in new batteries. Returned. That was a shame they used cheap hardware cause it seemed to be stury otherwise and did spread nicely the little while it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Mouse

customer_reviews.title: Uneven coverage unless you keep shaking seed into the dispenser slot
customer_reviews.text: I used Rebels brand tall fescue seed for this review. I like the spreader's push button, battery-powered operation and quality construction. However, after a few passes, the seed stopped freely feeding into the dispenser slot. I had to shake the device to keep a constant flow of seed. Also, undistributed seed would collect below the slot in the spinner compartment and would then dump out at intervals, leaving excessive amounts on the ground. Haven't tried the spreader with granular products - flow might be more constant than seed. Still... better than hand-cranking types.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Moore

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be neat to have a battery powered hand spreader. This one doesn't have to power to keep from getting clogged up by just about any granuals or powder I tried in it. Just the weight of the material you want to spread will stop the rotor, you'll end up trying to unclog it resulting in spills, etc. Spend a little less money and buy a hand crank hand spreader. I don't know how a company with the reputation of Scotts ever let this get past their testing lab.
customer_reviews.author: Patriot

customer_reviews.title: Simple , functional and handy !
customer_reviews.text: What I like about this is I can cover over 8k square feet with ease and then can put this item away in my storage shed without taking up much space at all. Its friendly and functional and allows adjustments to spread a little, medium amount or even up to full spread allowance this way you are not just over spreading with it full open like some do. Doesn't get hung up and is very consistent
customer_reviews.author: john nardi

customer_reviews.title: QC Issues; Not Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: This product worked for a whole 2 minutes before the spreader disk stopped rotating. I replaced the batteries, and it did not help. The issue is there was no seal, so Weed n Feed made its way into the internals of the device. I took it apart, reassembled, and it worked for another 30 seconds before suffering the same fate. The product I used was recommended for use in this spreader. I assume that others have received far better QC than what I had. I am not impressed, and I will be purchasing a different product soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jaguarbamf

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Spread Seed with a little "Hand Shaking"
customer_reviews.text: It's a perfect size spreader for a small yard (0.5 acres) and it's fun to use. I will admit though it does require a little "hand shaking" to get the seed or fertilizer to make it all the way to the bottom of the hopper. A little annoying but nothing a good "hand shaking" can't fix. Runs on 4 double AA's and hasn't given me any trouble yet other than seed not getting all the way to the bottom. Remember, "hand shaking" is important.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SUPER DUPER CHEAP
customer_reviews.text: Scotts Whiz Spreader: Made as cheaply as possible. Motor is very very weak. Sounds as if batteries are dead even while empty with fresh batteries installed. Strains just to spin the plastic spreader wheel. Jams frequently even after you manage to get it spinning. Frequently sticks ON. Basically uncleanable with water unless you tear it down and dry it every time you clean it. This would be a great idea if it had a decent motor and was made to be easily cleaned with a hose.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonozamA

customer_reviews.title: Great for personal single house use. No manual handle so extra batteries needed on larger projects
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent spreader. I am an exterminator and is it to fine insecticide granules. You can select the how much material you want to spread by adjusting the valve. The only negative is that the Batteries were out very quickly. For someone who has to perform 10-12 houses a day, you should have a stack of rechargeable batteries at hand. There is no manual lever to spread. For personal one home use, the power is not issue.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Carrero

customer_reviews.title: terrible product, poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: terrible product, poorly designed. Motor is too weak so it rarely works. The slightest thing prevents the rotating wheel from working -- including putting the EdgeGuard in place. The battery cover is awful -- it's designed so you have to use a small screwdriver to remove the battery cover! Since the motor eats up batteries, it's frustrating and an waste of time to have to find a screwdriver to remove the battery cover, replace the batteries, and put the battery cover back on. Just a terrible design of a product that could be useful. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rob W.

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother with this item. The battery power is insufficient to push out the product as required. This thing struggled upon 1st use. After that 1st attempt, I thought it might be clogged with lawn seed so I tried to carefully clean it but it still did not function properly (it sounded like a tiny cow with a stutter). As a last resort, I tried a small amount of lubricant to get the gears moving smoothly...but it seemed to still not have enough strength to push out the product. Please heed my warning and purchase something else.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jose

customer_reviews.title: Ice, Ice, Baby
customer_reviews.text: Before buying this product, I would buy a jug of ice melt with a vented top and I wasn’t happy with how the spread of the ice melt wasn’t very even. I didn’t have the problem with this spreader. The one issue I had was the spreader stopped working at one point and I thought the preinstalled batteries had run out of juice, but the ice melt had clogged up the works and once I had unclogged it the spreader went back to working. I was very happy overall how it worked spreading ice melt.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty NaylerTop Contributor: Poker

customer_reviews.title: Pure Crap
customer_reviews.text: Worthless. All three ran for about a minute and stopped working...simple as that! This is a really bad product! There is a reason why nearly 20% of reviewers give this spreader a one-star rating! Wish that I had read a bit about this instead of allowing myself to order so quickly. REMEMBER...THIS IS A PIECE OF PURE CRAP. Read what others have to say and the issue and consistency found in such reviews. Caveat Emptor...I think that Latin is correct for "buyer beware"! It certainly applies here.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: A complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I used this product recently for the first time, to spread Bifen granules, which has a sand like consistency. The batteries included with the unit failed after about 5 seconds. I had some rechargeable AA batteries, tried those, nada. Put 4 fresh alkaline batteries in,unit finally worked.....very poorly🤨. I had it on a medium setting ( 5 ). It would run for a few seconds, and when it worked it spread the product well . The unit would quit, I would shake it or piddle with the trigger, and it would run for a few more seconds . So, in summary I have to award 1 star, only because 0 stars was not a choice. A complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: thecos

customer_reviews.title: Will not work
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 10 minutes then died(thought it might have clump of fertilizer,so I dumped it and changed batteries, would not work even empty! It is junk...be warned do not buy! It was outside Amazons generous return window by 1 day so My bad😢
customer_reviews.author: ge8679

customer_reviews.title: EATS BATTERIES
customer_reviews.text: The Wiz Spreader runs on 4 Double A (AA) batteries which IMO don't last at all long enough. And, when the batteries run out you have to turn the spreader upside down (it is probably full of seeds or fert. when this happens). Bad design! As for the working side of the spreader a big 5 stars. It is fast and easy and it doesn't bother my back (the other spreaders all did). I like it a lot and doubt I'll go back to the old spreaders I have.
customer_reviews.author: F. Douglas Williams

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: this thing was a total waste of money. The spinner worked for about 30 seconds, then clogged up. I had to empty the hopper and clean it out thoroughly, and then load it up again just for it to quit after about 30 seconds again. I thought it might be the batteries, so I put in new batteries, but that didn't fix anything. The motor for the spinner is so weak that it can only handle about 20 grains of fertilizer/lime at a time. It is completely useless. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Terribly disappointing - please don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, but horrible piece of junk. The motor/battery just isn't strong enough. Test empty, worked fine. Loaded it up, it spun for about 2 seconds and jammed. Emptied, ran fine again. Loaded (half way), did't run. I even changed batteries. It won't run with more than a spoon-full of product. So it's basically worthless. It's too late for me to return it. I can't understand any of the positive reviews -- I AGREE WITH ALL OF THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS. I was wanting this to be better. I went back to a hand-crank model.
customer_reviews.author: Craig B

customer_reviews.title: Senior woman's review
customer_reviews.text: I though, why am I paying $15. for this contraption when I usually just throw the seed on the ground. Was I surprised. It's light to carry, easy to operate, and got the job done in minutes without the waste of throwing clumps of seed everywhere. Took me a no mess 15 minutes to do my small yard just walking around. My hands remained clean and easy peasy. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Florida

customer_reviews.title: Constantly jams on salt; weak motor
customer_reviews.text: The description states that this device will work for salt. It won't. The gear constantly jams up. If you're lucky, you might get about 10 seconds of use before you have to clear the gear. I thought perhaps that the batteries were weak, but the ones that shipped in the product were fully charged. I replaced them anyway with some brand new ones just to be sure. Not change. The motor is weak and jams at the slightest hint of resistance. I have a pellet ice melt product on the way- I'm hoping this will work for something like that. Otherwise, this becomes a functionless hopper. You'd be better off using a Solo cup.
customer_reviews.author: Tony V

customer_reviews.title: Constantly stops working
customer_reviews.text: I used this a few times and it seemed okay, though it did choke up every time I used it at some point so I'd have to dump it out, sometimes take it apart and clean out all of the jammed fertilizer pellets and it would start working again. Now it's to the point where it works for 30 seconds or so and just stops. I don't mind fixing things, but this is a constant fixer upper. It's ridiculous how unreliable it is. It's made of cheap plastic which doesn't hold up.
customer_reviews.author: MyNameIsMud

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get it wet
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty good for two years until I apparently got it too wet. I had just used grub killer and wanted it extra-clean. “Empty unused material back into product bag. Place the spreader on lawn and gently hose down to thoroughly rinse it out.” I guess I wasn’t gentle enough. :/
customer_reviews.author: Gooch

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for ice salt
customer_reviews.text: Does not work for ice/snow salt/melt. I've tried several different mixes. Rock salt is way to big. Finer snow melt works for like 3 uses (maybe 5 min each use) and then I have to put 4 new AA batteries in to get it to work at all. The spreader elecric motor is just way to week to deal with salt. Not sure how it does with fertilizer, I bought it specifically for salt
customer_reviews.author: Stephen W.

customer_reviews.title: Total Junk
customer_reviews.text: This this is a piece of junk. I didn't even last one year. The thing just died, I tried three sets of new batteries, it wasn't that. I contacted Scotts, but they never contacted me back. It's cheaply made and won't last. I gave it one star for easy to use and easy to spread because it's not easy if it's broken. It was easy when it worked, but that didn't last long.
customer_reviews.author: rccutler

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Mine. Stop working less than one month of having it .I thought the batteries was just dead . But since it getting warm I went in brought batteries, but when I put batteries in it. it didn't work . So I only had it less than a month and if I knew it was defective than ,I were would have return it but . But four months later now I realize it was defective, and not the batteries
customer_reviews.author: Mike braxton

customer_reviews.title: Broke After 20 seconds of using
customer_reviews.text: Super excited to use this with pet-safe ice melt. Followed the directions for setting dials to proper levels, works awesome for a few seconds, then died. I thought the batteries included maybe were old, so I put fresh ones in and....nothing. Cleaned it out entirely and tried another set of brand spanking new engerizer batteries. Nothing. Total waste of money and really needed that thing to work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Eh. Week. Poor design. Don't think they ever tested
customer_reviews.text: Halfway through first bag of pre emergent the spreader started backing up. No where near enough power. 4 as batteries. Dead in 15 minute s. Would be great with Ryobi battery and good gears etc. Guess it would be ok if yard was tiny but you could just sling by hand.
customer_reviews.author: H l garrett

customer_reviews.title: Seed Dumper -- Eh
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews and thought this would be the best choice for me. I also liked that I can use it to spread salt in the winter. However, upon it's first use it immediately began to drop clumps of seed due to build up in the spreader. Sadly, I can't see myself using this for long. I should have spent the extra money on something else.
customer_reviews.author: Keith S.

customer_reviews.title: It will do what I want...
customer_reviews.text: But its certainly not a robust or durable piece of equipment. If you have a small (Very Small !) yard, this may work for you. Material must be dry and it still doesn't throw it very far or wide. Also material piles up around the flail and when you stop the spinner and tilt it a small pile falls right on your yard, potentially burning it... Its just OK....
customer_reviews.author: Stbentoak

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: My dominant hand has a bad wrist so it’s difficult to use a traditional spreader. This spreader works great. You can use it with a single hand and it spreads everything from powder to heavy granules. I think with basic cleaning and making sure the moving parts stay clear this will work for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your $$$
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item, trusting the Scotts name, to be able to spread small quantities of de-icer on our very short, single lane driveway and path to our townhouse front door. The first time I used it, it worked great and I was so excited about how much easier this was going to be than my old plastic shaker bottle. And that was the LAST time it worked. Nothing I've tried has resolved the problem. Wish I hadn't thrown that shaker bottle away :(
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: TOY
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't what i expected. I had the idea from reading other reviews that it was a pretty good spreader. For my purpose it is almost useless. I only throws the grass seed about a 6 ft swath, when it isn't clogged. I tried spreading tall fescue and it clogged several times, so I checked the batteries for voltage and they were all new charge. I suppose it might do better with a finer grass seed such as bermuda. I didn't even try fertilize, which I doubt would even spread.
customer_reviews.author: SAMMY BLYTHE

customer_reviews.title: NOT A SALT SPREADER ! ! !
customer_reviews.text: NOT A SALT SPREADER It should not be advertised as a salt spreader. The motor is too weak to move salt beyond a 2 cup quantity. Any more than that and the motor won't turn. The gate design is such that the salt granules will jam it in the open position and thus the power to the motor won't stop and since the gate and safety switch are interlaced, it won't turn off untill you empty the contents, all 2 cups of it. As a Scotts product spreadr, it should work well, but that's not what I purchased it for.
customer_reviews.author: Tom 666

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Useful, Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I tried this little spreader for my little yard! It was super easy to use and it got the job done quickly without much effort. I dumped the fertilizer in, set the dial according to the fertilizer package, and walked at a reasonable pace while waving the spreader back and forth. Boom. Small lawn: fertilized. No need for a giant piece of equipment taking up a bunch of space in my garage all year for one day's use. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Introvert, Inspired

customer_reviews.title: Motor too weak to perform - doesn't spread well or at all.
customer_reviews.text: Using Scott's Weed & Feed, the granules fed through but it seemed slow. I even walked slowly and it was evident the coverage wasn't well enough. This thing will not put out grass seed. It locks up and doesn't have enough in its little motor. I've put in 3 sets of 4 AAA batteries all of which won't put through even on a #2 setting, seed requires 5-7.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Easy for everyone to do a great job
customer_reviews.text: I am one of the least able to do things in my yard LOL and wanted to save some money in hiring out. I did not even know what this was when I researched it but was pretty sure I could do it so I ordered the materials and this item. I understood it immediately when I got it... And my lawn went from being spotty and yellow in many parts to a lush green carpet. So easy to use and does the job perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: It spreads evenly but doesn't hold enough salt
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this to disburse salt after shoveling this winter. It does so pretty evenly and quickly as I use it along the driveway, but it doesn't hold enough for me to do our whole driveway in one or two passes. I'd be more enthusiastic about it if it were a little bigger and could need refilling less often. You also have to finesse the angle you use it or it doesn't work well at all. I'm hoping that will improve as I get more used to using it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely annoyed by this
customer_reviews.text: This is not an all-season spreader AT ALL. False advertising my friends. I tried to spread salt in a spot where just weeds grow (got the idea from medieval documentary), to keep them from coming back, and this weak thing will not push salt. Extremely annoyed by this. I guess it is enough to spread seeds but NOT salt as they claim! In addition, now it doesn't work at all! Tried, and failed! :'(
customer_reviews.author: SalsaFrenzy

customer_reviews.title: Works great, excellent for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is great. I seeded my whole yard in little time. It was evenly and well dispersed. Not too heavy. Doesn’t take a lot of space to store. Very pleased with this low cost purchase. I have seen professionals use this for a lawn treatment in my yard. Great product and price.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Gabellini

customer_reviews.title: I'm going manual.
customer_reviews.text: Product works. It definitely throws down seed faster than by the manual (hind wind), but battery life is not great, and it takes 4 AA batteries. This unit is harder to clean as well. Some fertilizer I was throwing down ended up getting wet, and the thing is near impossible to clean. Would definitely recommend the hand wind instead.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect for me !
customer_reviews.text: This works great ! As a matter of fact this morning I did not use it to put some fertilizer on about a 5 foot by 8 foot bare spot on my lawn and it took forever and it wasn't able to apply the fertilizer evenly. I used this to spread a 2 pound mix of wildflower seeds in a rather large area. I was able to do that in less time than the spot I did by hand. This spreader did a more even coating and no problems with it whatsoever. I've only used this a few times and have no complaints. This Wizz sure beats doing the jobs by hand !
customer_reviews.author: Alana

customer_reviews.title: Good product for light seed and food plots
customer_reviews.text: Spreader works well for small seed. I wouldn't recommend for fertilizer, the motor is not strong enough. You have to shake spreader up and down to allow the mechanism to spin because of the fertilizer weight on the rotar. However, it's worth the money for the seeder. Previously I've wasted a lot of money trying to spread small seed, my concentrations were always too heavy. The spreader payed for itself first time out by distributing seed correctly. Downside, motor is weak, batteries provided don't last so bring batteries with you the first time out.
customer_reviews.author: dave anderson

customer_reviews.title: Saves time and effort
customer_reviews.text: Looking to replace my walk behind spreader that took up so much space, when I found this. I love it!! I'm prone to not reading the fine print so when I ordered I didn't realize it was battery operated. When I got it and tried it out I was sold! Better than I expected since I figured it was a hand cranked spreader. I finished my yard in no time. It was so easy squeeze the trigger and it does all the work ensuring an even spread. Spend the extra $5 and buy this instead of the hand crank ones. It feels like your cheating it's so easy.
customer_reviews.author: J.H.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this for spreading ice melt though it is advertised as being usable for both ice melt and grass seed. It jammed after the first use and was very difficult to get cleared. It does not open up easily to clear. If you want to spend 30 minutes cleaning it out after each use fine. The whole idea is to have something quick to grab and easy to use. This is not for you in that case.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff T. Hamand

customer_reviews.title: This thing really works!
customer_reviews.text: Very surprised how well this spreader works. Had previous hand crank ones and was worried my wife bought a gimmic for my birthday. Let me say that it is no gimmic. It’s very easy to use and comfortable to hold. I was able to quickly cover my front and back yard in a short time. And of course the storage is great. Having large spreaders was always a pain to store in my shed. This thing fits on my shelf. Motor is strong enough to spread even damp fertilizer. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Jakubczyk

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the granules or seeds get too big
customer_reviews.text: This is my second device in two years. My first one seemed to work well until it suddenly died while spreading ice melt last winter. I purchased a second one just because it worked so well for my lawn but I plan on using something else to spread my ice melt next winter. This goes along with all the other reviews that mention the motor not being able to keep up with whatever it needs to spread.
customer_reviews.author: pablomac

customer_reviews.title: Best ever salad patch.
customer_reviews.text: I always had a difficult time spreading tiny salad seeds evenly. I have the best stand ever. After that I opened it up some and put my fertilizer down with it and then preen we’d preventer. It would easily do a space several times larger than mine which is 30 by60.
customer_reviews.author: Varina Hokie

customer_reviews.title: Best Spreader and takes up less room
customer_reviews.text: This little $20 spreader is well worth the $$'s. It does exactly what it says, covered over 5K sq feet in minutes. The real benefit for me is that it really does not take up much space in the garden shed for something I only use 4 times per year. Not something I can say about the larger push spreaders.
customer_reviews.author: Steve F

customer_reviews.title: Honestly, just buy a rolling spreader....
customer_reviews.text: 3 sets of fresh batteries later, it still didn’t spread very well at all. Quite literally the weakest motor known to man. I thought it was a battery issue. Nope. It’s just a weak motor. Worse yet, it leaves a trickle line of seed/fertilizer on your route. Complete waste of money. Threw it in the garbage in disgust.
customer_reviews.author: Bill U.

customer_reviews.title: Mine came with dead batteries
customer_reviews.text: Works OK but had to continually shake and bend the unit forward to get the salt into the chute and it came with 4 dead batteries. It is also more time consuming to use this than to just toss a cup of salt onto your driveway. For this it is necessary to scoop the salt into the spreader and then it runs out quickly. Far more time efficient to just toss a cup of water onto the desired area than to carefully place the salt into this thing then spread.
customer_reviews.author: Secret

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a little bit then stopped working
customer_reviews.text: It worked once to spread some fertilizer over my lawn. At one point, the trigger got stuck in the on position, but I was able to get it unstuck after some jiggling of the trigger. The next time I tried to use it, the motor would not spin. I returned this first unit for a replacement. The replacement unit stopped working halfway through the next fertilizer application. I returned the second unit for a refund. It's too bad because it is easy to use and spreads well. There seems to be a quality issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ramón

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the results
customer_reviews.text: Great buy. I was trying to broadcast by hand the first time and was not getting an even spread. Opted to buy this the second time around and very happy with the results. Less wasted material as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dzu Duong

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It works great but it doesn't work the same as the product gets low; the feed gets less dense and harder to control. I find myself shaking the device towards the end - as it gets down to about 1/5 full - in order to keep the product moving to the hopper. Unfortunately when you do that a bunch just sort of falls out of the device. All in all it still works just fine and made quick work of getting my relatively small yard covered.
customer_reviews.author: ccampanale

customer_reviews.title: Works great with granules, made in China
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Uses common D cell batteries - Easy to set the spread rate - Easy to set the spread width - Easy to clean - Effortless to use - Sturdy construction Cons: - Battery compartment is fastened with a small Philips screw instead of a latch so you need to use a screwdriver to install or change batteries. A latch would have worked better. - Made in China
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: This thing sure spreads the ferterlizer where you want it without all the wrist work. I did a whole bag in under 30 minutes. Every Senior that can't get their kids to do the yard needs this.
customer_reviews.author: Judge Roy Bean

customer_reviews.title: I tried to make it work, but...
customer_reviews.text: I ignored the bad reviews. Don't do as I did. This thing is under-powered, clogs easily, spreads unevenly, has a sticky on/off switch, and generally is a pain to use. After one summer of trying multiple times and ways to get it to work, it just died. That was the best part about owning it.
customer_reviews.author: Clare B. Dunkle

customer_reviews.title: When it was working.
customer_reviews.text: When it was working the easy of spread and angle of spread was great. When it was working it was easy to use. When it was working it was highly maneuverable. When it was working. The hand held spreader made it through one complete front yard event. The motor stopped and I thought..wow... the battery life was not what I expected. I changed the batteries and it did not see action again. I tried another set of batteries and still not joy. When it was working, i enjoyed it, when it was working.
customer_reviews.author: James Davis

product_meta.title: Scotts Wizz Hand-Held Spreader with EdgeGuard Technology - Apply Grass Seed, Fertilizer or Weed Control Products, Battery Powered, Holds up to 2,500 sq ft of Scotts Lawn Products
product_meta.description: Size:2.5 MThe battery-powered Scotts Wizz Spreader is the quick and easy option when it comes to spreading. The Wizz holds up to 2,500 sq. ft. of Scotts lawn care products and features Scotts exclusive EdgeGuard and HandyLock Technology. Use it year round to feed, seed, and weed! EdgeGuard Technology allows for 5-foot broadcast control. Our most advanced spreader yet, powered by 4 AA batteries with 23 settings for unbeatable accuracy. Perfect for lawn seed, fertilizer and weed control products. Not recommended for rock salt use.
feature_bullets: Battery-powered spreader you can use year round—designed to spread grass seed, lawn fertilizer and weed control products
Designed to cover up to 2,500 sq. ft. using Scotts lawn care product
5-foot broadcast with control of EdgeGuard Technology
Our most advanced spreader yet, powered by 4 AA batteries with 23 settings for unbeatable accuracy
Perfect for lawn seed, fertilizer and weed control products
